ResourceHeader.Description: The spinning twin-fluxgate magnetometer was designed to provide the orthogonal components of the magnetic field: Hp was parallel to the spin axis that was held nearly in the direction of Earth's axis, He was directed toward Earth center, and Hn pointed eastward. The magnetometer had a range of +/- 400 nT (without saturation) and a resolution of 0.1 nT over a range of +/- 50 nT. The sensitivity of the magnetometer was about 0.2 nT.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA; Dr. Harold Leinbach; Dr. Ernest Hildner; Dr. Joann Joselyn; Dr. Howard J. Singer

Instrument.Caveats: There is no magnetic field data from this instrument.
